posts.name: Ben Gottschalk
posts.cooked: Hi, my team received the new radio with the game pieces a few days ago, I was able to get it programed and able to connect to my laptop, but in driverstation the warning 44002 keeps being thrown, with the only item being good being the robot radio. If anyone could help me figure this out this would be great as I am sort of the only programmer for my team, and I have no mentors to help me with this.

posts.name: Fletch
posts.cooked: Is the radio connected to anything else (i.e. roborio)? If not, that may be why.  Can you show a screenshot of what you see in the DS (indicators and error message)?

posts.name: Ben Gottschalk
posts.cooked:
The radio is connected to power and the roborio, but that is it.

Driver station throws this warning

Warning ﻿﻿ 44002 ﻿﻿ Ping Results:  ﻿link-bad﻿, DS radio(.4)-bad﻿,  robot radio(.1)-GOOD﻿,  roboRIO(.2)-bad﻿, FMS -bad﻿﻿ Driver Station

posts.name: Joseph Walters
posts.cooked:
Did you set the correct team number on the radios configuration page?

And likewise perhaps run the teamnumbersetter and set the same team# on the robot as you program the radio.

Those two need to be the same for the RIO to get the correct IP address.

Additionally a screenshot as @Fletch1373 requests of the driver station page pictured could help us help you with further diagnostic steps:

Edit: adding link to setting up DriverStation per answers below mine.

This article describes the use and features of the FRC ® Driver Station Powered by NI LabVIEW. For information on installing the Driver Station software see this document. Starting the FRC Driver S...

link_counts.title: roboRIO Team Number Setter — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation
FRC Driver Station Powered by NI LabVIEW — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.name: SLAB-Mr.Thomas
posts.cooked:
OP @Jotty must set the team number in the Driver Station, too.

roboRIO, Radio, and Driver Station all must match the team number.

posts.name: Fletcher
posts.cooked:
DS radio(.4)-bad﻿ is expected when not connected to the field.

As for the RIO, verify that your team number is configured both in the driver station software and on the roboRIO.

posts.cooked: Can you post a picture of the roborio webpage? Just go to 172.22.11.2 in a web browser while usb connected.

posts.name: Thad House
posts.cooked: That hostname is correct, but the DNS name is wrong. Try shutting everything off for a minute or 2, including your laptop, and booting everything up again.

posts.name: SLAB-Mr.Thomas
posts.cooked: Isn’t the IP address wrong also? Wouldn’t the radio hand out 10.66.33.2 (not 10.66.33.200) if the radio is correctly configured? Maybe time will heal the wound as you suggest.

posts.name: Jack Doherty
posts.cooked: We had a similar issue. Follow the steps here: Imaging your roboRIO 2 — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

link_counts.title: Imaging your roboRIO 2 — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation
VH-109 radio not assigning roboRIO expected IP address

posts.name: Thad House
posts.cooked: The radio uses the dns name to know which device is the roborio, and hand it .2. It that’s wrong, it will just hand out of the normal pool.

posts.name: Ben Gottschalk
posts.cooked: It seems to be working now that I gave it some time! Thank you everyone that helped, I appreciate it a ton here!

posts.name: Kiet Chau
posts.cooked: Just a friendly reminder! Make sure you update to 1.2.6
